content: Is this an indication that the Republican Party is truly fracturing, or are real conservatives making a move to take their party back from the "neo" conservatives? Given the recent flap over Rush, it could go either way right now. I'm not suggesting that the younger McCain is, or is not, a "true" conservative, but her father was before he sold out to the "neo" faction of the party for campaign support. Perhaps he's behind this. Or, perhaps not. In any case, Meghan makes a good point that the current incarnation of the Republican Party IS turning off the younger generation, who voted in huge numbers for Obama, and they ARE the future of this country. Meghan McCain calls Ann Coulter 'offensive' and 'radical' First, Republicans fractured over Rush Limbaugh. Now blogger Meghan McCain -- daughter of the 2008 Republican presidential nominee, Arizona Sen. John McCain -- has taken aim at conservative commentator Ann Coulter. "Certain individuals continue to perpetuate negative stereotypes about Republicans. Especially Republican women," McCain writes at The Daily Beast under the headline "My Beef with Ann Coulter." McCain, who describes herself as a "progressive Republican," says she finds Coulter "offensive, radical, insulting, and confusing all at the same" and argues that she appeals to a wing of the party that is dying off. "If figureheads like Ann Coulter are turning me off, then they are definitely turning off other members of my generation as well," says McCain, who is 24.... "http://blogs.usatoday.com/onpolitics/2009/03/meghan-mccain-c.html"

In any case, Meghan makes a good point that the current incarnation of the Republican Party IS turning off the younger generation, who voted in huge numbers for Obama, and they ARE the future of this country. title: Meghan McCain calls Ann Coulter "offensive" and "radical."
Meghan McCain calls Ann Coulter "offensive" and "radical."

content: I would love to see the Republicans put up their beloved Speakers like Rush or Coulter or Boortz for POTUS Nomination next election. Bet each one of them would turn it down. They can beat up Obama all they want, but at least he had gutz enough to run, win and try. I would give any person much more credit for trying than someone just sitting on the sidelines with nothing to loose complaining about how terrible things are just to draw a simple crowd of obedient servants for monetary gain. I gota even give Bush credit for that. “The men who try to do something and fail are infinitely better than those who try nothing and succeed” - Lloyd Jones

title: Meghan McCain calls Ann Coulter "offensive" and "radical."

content: You post this original article as if it is some sort of shocking surprise. I guess no one remembers Coulter was never a McCain fan until he called Palin to the ticket. In fact her reaction to McCain's winning of the Republican nomination was to go on Hannity and claim she was now voting for Hillary. "Hillary's my girl." ----Ann Coulter Because she knew, contrary to what Stillkit claims in the OP, that McCain was never and has never been a true conservative. Yeah. Those who snidely claim they'd like to see Rush and Coulter on a ticket are balanced by those who'd like to see them run against Michael Moore and Randy Rhodes. Rush and Ann would win by name recognition alone.

content: "How To Talk To a Liberal (If You Must)" by Ann Coulter, the book that saved John and Cindys marriage, Cindy probably has read it 20 times by now. I like to listen to Ann, I know something interesting is going to happen, she's extremely quick with the tounge, very excellent recall abilities, I'd hate to be married to her, she'd remember everything I ever screwed up on, a typical womens memory is more then we all want at times. Yea, yea, yea, I know I'm gonna get flak from some of you,,, I like to listen to her, what can I say, at least I'm honest about it. This message has been edited. Last edited by: BAGodbehere, Tue 10 March 2009 02:12 AM

title: Meghan McCain calls Ann Coulter "offensive" and "radical."

content: and now it's time for...great debate moments with ann coulter.... If we're so cruel to minorities, why do they keep coming here? Why aren't they sneaking across the Mexican border to make their way to the Taliban? We should invade their countries, kill their leaders and convert them to Christianity. We weren't punctilious about locating and punishing only Hitler and his top officers. We carpet-bombed German cities; we killed civilians. That's war. And this is war. While the form of treachery varies slightly from case to case, liberals always manage to take the position that most undermines American security. "If I'm going to say anything about John Edwards in the future, I'll just wish he had been killed in a terrorist assassination plot." "I was going to have a few comments about John Edwards but you have to go into rehab if you use the word ***got." "We need to execute people like (John Walker Lindh) in order to physically intimidate liberals." "My only regret with Timothy McVeigh is he did not go to the New York Times Building." "Press passes can't be that hard to come by if the White House allows that old Arab Helen Thomas to sit within yards of the President." Colmes: "You hate liberals. You despise liberals. This is unbelievable.We should execute them to make liberals scared?" Coulter: "Right. Right!" "...a cruise missile is more important than Head Start." "The presumption of innocence only means you don't go right to jail." "Let's say I go out every night, I meet a guy and have sex with him. Good for me. I'm not married." and finally...... To a disabled Vietnam vet: "People like you caused us to lose that war."

We weren't punctilious about locating and punishing only Hitler and his top officers. We carpet-bombed German cities; we killed civilians. That's war. And this is war. While the form of treachery varies slightly from case to case, liberals always manage to take the position that most undermines American security. "If I'm going to say anything about John Edwards in the future, I'll just wish he had been killed in a terrorist assassination plot." "I was going to have a few comments about John Edwards but you have to go into rehab if you use the word ***got." "We need to execute people like (John Walker Lindh) in order to physically intimidate liberals." "My only regret with Timothy McVeigh is he did not go to the New York Times Building." "Press passes can't be that hard to come by if the White House allows that old Arab Helen Thomas to sit within yards of the President." Colmes: "You hate liberals. You despise liberals. This is unbelievable.We should execute them to make liberals scared?" Coulter: "Right. Right!" "...a cruise missile is more important than Head Start." "The presumption of innocence only means you don't go right to jail." "Let's say I go out every night, I meet a guy and have sex with him. Good for me. I'm not married." and finally...... To a disabled Vietnam vet: "People like you caused us to lose that war."
title: Meghan McCain calls Ann Coulter "offensive" and "radical."

content: Is this an indication that the Republican Party is truly fracturing, or are real conservatives making a move to take their party back from the "neo" conservatives? Given the recent flap over Rush, it could go either way right now. I'm not suggesting that the younger McCain is, or is not, a "true" conservative, but her father was before he sold out to the "neo" faction of the party for campaign support. Perhaps he's behind this. Or, perhaps not. In any case, Meghan makes a good point that the current incarnation of the Republican Party IS turning off the younger generation, who voted in huge numbers for Obama, and they ARE the future of this country. Meghan McCain calls Ann Coulter 'offensive' and 'radical' First, Republicans fractured over Rush Limbaugh. Now blogger Meghan McCain -- daughter of the 2008 Republican presidential nominee, Arizona Sen. John McCain -- has taken aim at conservative commentator Ann Coulter. "Certain individuals continue to perpetuate negative stereotypes about Republicans. Especially Republican women," McCain writes at The Daily Beast under the headline "My Beef with Ann Coulter." McCain, who describes herself as a "progressive Republican," says she finds Coulter "offensive, radical, insulting, and confusing all at the same" and argues that she appeals to a wing of the party that is dying off. "If figureheads like Ann Coulter are turning me off, then they are definitely turning off other members of my generation as well," says McCain, who is 24.... "http://blogs.usatoday.com/onpolitics/2009/03/meghan-mccain-c.html"

Perhaps he's behind this. Or, perhaps not. In any case, Meghan makes a good point that the current incarnation of the Republican Party IS turning off the younger generation, who voted in huge numbers for Obama, and they ARE the future of this country. In any case, Meghan makes a good point that the current incarnation of the Republican Party IS turning off the younger generation, who voted in huge numbers for Obama, and they ARE the future of this country. Meghan McCain calls Ann Coulter 'offensive' and 'radical' First, Republicans fractured over Rush Limbaugh. Now blogger Meghan McCain -- daughter of the 2008 Republican presidential nominee, Arizona Sen. John McCain -- has taken aim at conservative commentator Ann Coulter. "Certain individuals continue to perpetuate negative stereotypes about Republicans. Especially Republican women," McCain writes at The Daily Beast under the headline "My Beef with Ann Coulter." McCain, who describes herself as a "progressive Republican," says she finds Coulter "offensive, radical, insulting, and confusing all at the same" and argues that she appeals to a wing of the party that is dying off. "If figureheads like Ann Coulter are turning me off, then they are definitely turning off other members of my generation as well," says McCain, who is 24.... "http://blogs.usatoday.com/onpolitics/2009/03/meghan-mccain-c.html"
reply: I wonder how Conservatives will smear her?
title: Meghan McCain calls Ann Coulter "offensive" and "radical."

She's McCains Daughter, thats it She's entitled to her opinion just as Anne Coulter is Dont like Anne, Dont listen to her to say the GOP is Fracturing because a 24 year old doesnt like a Commentator/Author is a Stretch Even for Dems

content: I would love to see the Republicans put up their beloved Speakers like Rush or Coulter or Boortz for POTUS Nomination next election. Bet each one of them would turn it down. They can beat up Obama all they want, but at least he had gutz enough to run, win and try. I would give any person much more credit for trying than someone just sitting on the sidelines with nothing to loose complaining about how terrible things are just to draw a simple crowd of obedient servants for monetary gain. I gota even give Bush credit for that. “The men who try to do something and fail are infinitely better than those who try nothing and succeed” - Lloyd Jones

content: You post this original article as if it is some sort of shocking surprise. I guess no one remembers Coulter was never a McCain fan until he called Palin to the ticket. In fact her reaction to McCain's winning of the Republican nomination was to go on Hannity and claim she was now voting for Hillary. "Hillary's my girl." ----Ann Coulter Because she knew, contrary to what Stillkit claims in the OP, that McCain was never and has never been a true conservative. Yeah. Those who snidely claim they'd like to see Rush and Coulter on a ticket are balanced by those who'd like to see them run against Michael Moore and Randy Rhodes. Rush and Ann would win by name recognition alone.

Obviously this is my experience and opinion and it's certainly not ALL of the young voters because there are some that actually get involved and know what they're talking about.

content: "How To Talk To a Liberal (If You Must)" by Ann Coulter, the book that saved John and Cindys marriage, Cindy probably has read it 20 times by now. I like to listen to Ann, I know something interesting is going to happen, she's extremely quick with the tounge, very excellent recall abilities, I'd hate to be married to her, she'd remember everything I ever screwed up on, a typical womens memory is more then we all want at times. Yea, yea, yea, I know I'm gonna get flak from some of you,,, I like to listen to her, what can I say, at least I'm honest about it. This message has been edited. Last edited by: BAGodbehere, Tue 10 March 2009 02:12 AM

title: Meghan McCain calls Ann Coulter "offensive" and "radical."

content: and now it's time for...great debate moments with ann coulter.... If we're so cruel to minorities, why do they keep coming here? Why aren't they sneaking across the Mexican border to make their way to the Taliban? We should invade their countries, kill their leaders and convert them to Christianity. We weren't punctilious about locating and punishing only Hitler and his top officers. We carpet-bombed German cities; we killed civilians. That's war. And this is war. While the form of treachery varies slightly from case to case, liberals always manage to take the position that most undermines American security. "If I'm going to say anything about John Edwards in the future, I'll just wish he had been killed in a terrorist assassination plot." "I was going to have a few comments about John Edwards but you have to go into rehab if you use the word ***got." "We need to execute people like (John Walker Lindh) in order to physically intimidate liberals." "My only regret with Timothy McVeigh is he did not go to the New York Times Building." "Press passes can't be that hard to come by if the White House allows that old Arab Helen Thomas to sit within yards of the President." Colmes: "You hate liberals. You despise liberals. This is unbelievable.We should execute them to make liberals scared?" Coulter: "Right. Right!" "...a cruise missile is more important than Head Start." "The presumption of innocence only means you don't go right to jail." "Let's say I go out every night, I meet a guy and have sex with him. Good for me. I'm not married." and finally...... To a disabled Vietnam vet: "People like you caused us to lose that war."
